meanings.definition: A right or privilege exclusive to a particular individual or class.
meanings.sent1: The king's prerogatives included the power to grant pardons.
meanings.sent2: Only the senior members of the club have the prerogatives to vote on new rules.
meanings.sent3: It was quite the prerogatives of the principal to declare a surprise holiday.
meanings.sent4: The CEO's prerogatives to make executive decisions are unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The prerogatives of being the eldest sibling meant setting the rules for the younger ones.

meanings.definition: An exclusive privilege or right exercised by a person or group.
meanings.sent1: The country's elite enjoyed the prerogatives of attending the exclusive gala.
meanings.sent2: The board members held the prerogatives to approve major company decisions.
meanings.sent3: It was a funny sight to see the cat claiming the prerogatives to the comfiest spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The artist's prerogatives to paint with unconventional colors set him apart.
meanings.sent5: The prerogatives of the captain included choosing the team's strategy for the game.
